Prerequisites: MAC 1105 C COLLEGE ALGEBRA, EQUIVALENT, OR HIGHER.
Course Description:
THIS COURSE IS AN INTRODUCTION TO FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING THAT SPECIALIZES IN THE PROCESSES AND
PRINCIPLES USED TO PREPARE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THIS COURSE WILL FOCUS ON THE PURPOSE AND
CONTENT OF THE FOUR BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDING THE PREPARATION OF THESE
STATEMENTS AS WELL AS INTERPRETING INFORMATION FOR DECISION-MAKING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.
THE STUDENTS SHALL DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE FUNCTIONAL PRINCIPLES AND PROCEDURES IN
DOUBLE\ENTRY ACCOUNTING WITH EMPHASIS ON MANAGEMENTS USE OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION.
2.
THE STUDENTS SHALL DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF HOW DATA ARE ACCUMULATED AND USE CRITICAL
THINKING AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS IN PROBLEM-SOLVING.
3.
THE STUDENTS SHALL DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE MEANING OF FINANCIAL DATA FOUND ON THE
BUSINESS STATEMENTS AND DEVELOP INSIGHTS INTO WAYS COMPANIES USE ACCOUNTING INFORMATION
TO MAKE DECISION AND PROBLEM\SOLVING.
4.
STUDENTS SHALL ACQUIRE CONCEPTS OF THE IMPORTANCE OF ACCURACY AND HONESTY IN THE KEEPING OF
RECORDS.
5.
UNDERSTANDINGS AND ATTITUDES RELATED TO THE ORGANIZATION AND OPERATION OF THE PRIVATEENTERPRISE
ECONOMIC SYSTEM SHALL BE DEVELOPED BY STUDENTS.
6.
DESIRABLE BUSINESS ATTITUDES, WORK HABITS, AND REAL-WORLD SKILLS FOR SUCCESS IN BUSINESS
OCCUPATION SHALL BE DEVELOPED BY STUDENTS.
7.
THE STUDENTS, THROUGH AN EXPOSURE TO VARIOUS EXPERIENCES, SHALL DEVELOP INTEREST IN AN ATTITUDE
FOR ACCOUNTING OR BUSINESS AS A CAREER.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
